conclusion: Identify the given information: AB = 15 cm, BC = 20 cm, balls released every 0.1 seconds, 1:1 scale relationship.
Determine the acceleration: balls experience constant acceleration due to gravity.
Calculate acceleration using formula: a = (BC - AB) / T^2.
Substitute values to calculate acceleration: a = 500 cm/s^2.
Determine velocity of ball B using average velocity formula: v_B = (AB + BC) / 2T.
Substitute values to calculate velocity of ball B: v_B = 175 cm/s.
Calculate time for ball B to reach point B using formula: v_B = a t_B.
Determine number of balls released in 0.35 seconds: 0.35 s / 0.1 s = 3.5.
Conclusion: 3 balls released before ball B reaches point B, 2 balls rolling on top of ball A.
Final Answer: There are 2 small steel balls rolling on top of ball A.
